intro: Teucrium lusitanicum, commonly known as Portuguese germander, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and North Africa. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its small, tubular flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the stems. Teucrium lusitanicum is often found in dry, rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal and potential medicinal properties.
